"""
 This method is to be called from remote Express instance to check
 if in Express instance we can create a Person object with an unique 
 reference within Express services.
 This method can also called when customer inputs its employees in Configurator.
 This method will check as well if provided user name is a valid 
 one (doesn't contain reserved characters in it)
 """
 request = context.REQUEST
 portal = context.getPortalObject()
 reference = kw.get('reference', None)
 ignore_users_from_same_instance = kw.get('ignore_users_from_same_instance', 0)
 if editor is not None:
 # script is used as a form field's validator
 reference = editor
 
 # get Business Configuration
 business_configuration = context.restrictedTraverse(request.get('business_configuration_key'))
 
 # as every instance has a hard coded 'admin' user (owner of ERP5 Site instance)
 # also check if reference is actually allowed (i.e. doesn't contain special symbols)?
 # make sure we never allow it
 if reference in ["admin"] or not portal.ERP5Site_isValidUserName(reference):
 return 0
 
 # first check if a Business Configuration has not already "reserved" it
 # through a Person Configuration Item which when build will create a real
 # Nexedi ERP5 account.
 person_configurator_item_list = portal.ERP5Site_getPersonListByInsensitiveReference(
 reference=reference,
 portal_type='Person Configurator Item')
 
 if business_configuration is not None:
 # when in Configuratorm mode we the user may have created already Person Configurator Item
 # in this business configuration. Make sure that going to Previous page will not stop
 # validation of username uniqueness 
 # XXX: this should be done using a ZSQL Query rather than getting object
 # there should not be a speed penalty of loading objects in RAM as in most cases
 # it's either 0 (i.e. not used) or 1 (used)
 person_configurator_item_list = filter(lambda x: x.getObject().getParentValue().getParentValue() == 
 business_configuration, \
 person_configurator_item_list)
 
 if len(person_configurator_item_list) > 0:
 return 0
 
 # ... then check already created accounts
 found_user_list = portal.ERP5Site_getPersonListByInsensitiveReference(reference=reference)
 
 if len(found_user_list):
 # not unique
 return 0
 
 return 1
